website_summaries.verdict: A larger food or water bowl for cages and crates that’s held securely in place, but can be difficult to remove without spilling contents.
pros: Attaches easily and securely to pet crates and cages
Fits tightly in holder bracket, discouraging pets from dislodging it
cons: Hanger clip can rust if not detached and dried frequently
Edges of holder bracket look dangerous to some pet owners
Full bowl can tip slightly and leak

customer_reviews.title: Spent $20 on 4 bowls, great for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between getting these crate bowls or not based on reviews. However, for the price I opted to get them anyway because I thought some of the reviews were petty. These bowls are sturdy. I bought the 20oz ones and the 1 quart ones. The diameter doesn’t change, just the depthness of the bowls. If the bowls don’t come off as easily you can always widen the sides by pulling them apart a little. Just takes a little common sense. The bowls also do not tilt once you attach and screw them on the crate, even with food and water they are held in place pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Faby G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pets that toss...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three sizes of these because they are so awesome! I bought an extra for travelling. I use them in my flemish giant bunny's cage for his pellets and water as he prefers to toss and turn everything over. You can put them at varying hights, though I notice the larger bowls (20oz+) has a tendency to tip forward. He has tried to bite the bowls off the clips and they do NOT come off (He has a pretty hard tug). Dimentions: 10oz: 5"Dia 1.75"depth 20oz: 6" Dia 2" depth 1L: 6"Dia 2.75"depth
customer_reviews.author: lmpromptuTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great for a big bunny!
customer_reviews.text: Apple is a very, very, very big rabbit. She's been rattling her water bottle non stop lately, so we wanted to try a bowl. This bowl isn't too deep, so she doesn't have to strain her neck to reach the water. She tried to rattle and pull on the bowl but it stays perfectly in place. The purchase was soo worth it!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Water we have here?
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I think it could be better though as the latching mechanism is rusting but I love that the bowl is removable without having to remove the entire holder from the kennel. Good design. When the bowl is removed, it does leave the edges of the holder exposed and this could be dangerous I guess. I only take the bowl off to clean and fill it, and I trust my dog to not jam her face into a metal object so it doesn't concern me much but each buyer should consider this for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality easy clean
customer_reviews.text: First impression, very good quality bowls, but why would you put stickers inside the bowl?? It took me some time but I got it all out. They are very easy to clean after you get The sticker out. The bowl tends to be a little dificult to remove. helpful hint i pulled on the brckets arms to stretch them out a little now the bowl slides on and off with ease. without being to loose so the bowl falls out. perfect for my routy squirrel who tends to knock over his bowl. added bonus they also look amazing. would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: allison

customer_reviews.title: for the love of God do not take the bowl out of the black part to clean it
customer_reviews.text: ***i wrote this when I had taken the bowl out to clean it but I have been trying and it cannot get it back in omg I’m getting so pissed. Does this company just expect you to never put the bowl in the dishwasher Okay so I’m an idiot. For some reason when I bought this I thought I could just slide the bowl in and out every time I wanted to refill it. That is not the case, the bowl does not slide in and out easy at all so if I filled it up there would be water all over the place. Going to be a pain in the ass to take it apart all the time.
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, but Too Stiff
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to install, just unscrew, place, and screw the wingnuts back on. However, the part that holds the bowl is too stiff. It makes it impossible to remove without spilling most of the contents and is a nightmare for people like me that dump the bowl and put in fresh water everyday. I gave up and have the bowl just sitting outside of the crate. While that defeats the purpose, my puppy is still young and not put in the crate very long so the holder won't be needed until I go back to work and stays in the crate are longer. The bowl is great quality, easy to clean, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to remove with "new"?? design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my chinchilla cage to hold food. It was easy to clip onto the cage and looks great. But the style I seemed to get does not match what I see in pictures of the product description or some customer pictures. It is extremely difficult to remove. My husband is a strong man and he still struggled to get it out and the remaining food in the dish went flying everywhere due to the strength needed. It is not a snappy fit, it's basically permanent. Maybe the bigger bowls are better? I ordered the 10oz bowl and need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: L. FicksTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this water bowl for my dog's crate due to a recent medical condition where she needed constant access to water. The bowl and attachment was easy to install, but it was nearly impossible to take the bowl in and out for cleaning and refilling. It was SO tight and hard to take out. I would spill water all over her crate and need to replace the bedding constantly. I finally threw it away and just put a small bowl in the corner of her crate and that's worked 1000% better.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Gee

customer_reviews.title: Bowl can't be removed to clean
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say it but at first i thought this was going to be great. HOWEVER, the fact is that the bowl is clamped in so tightly that its almost impossible to remove, and once its attached to the cage even harder. Now try to remove it half full of dirty water that needs to be changed FORGET IT! you'll spen more time cleaning up the mess than bottle feeding your pet :(
customer_reviews.author: Budd J. Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Great product, durable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: With 5 dogs and a long line of fosters and rescues we've used a wide assortment of kennel bowls. After finding this brand and style we slowly but surely switched all our kennels over to these. The plastic ones break if the dogs running into them, can be chewed and damaged. The Midwest stainless steel is sturdy, the part that attaches to the kennel holds in place firmly with the included spacer grip, the bowl is easily cleaned in the dishwasher and the dogs have no problem eating and drinking out of them. We've had some for several years now and look just as good as the day we bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this product for several reasons. 1) the bowl snaps into the hanger bracket. If water is in the bowl, there is a good chance that water will spill either snapping the bowl into the hanger or in removing the bowl for refilling/cleaning. 2) if the bowl is removed, there are 2 blunt, but pointy ends of the hanger bracket that might become a source of injury. While the product seems well constructed, the design is not safe or workable' for me.
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome product
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed. They are sturdy in the kennel and my dogs won't be able to knock them down. I added a picture with a A&W soda can for size reference I got the 4cup ones. It is a little difficult to remove the bowels but I gave the metal a little stretch and their perfect. And the stickers were super easy to come off. I'm thinking in hotter places you should stick them in the freezer for a bit then try and peel off the stickers. All in all I give this product a A+
customer_reviews.author: Aujonae D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay clipped in, any pressure on the bowl tips it out, water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this bowl as I was looking for a solution for my dogs in their kennels during the day. The bowl is rounded such that it doesn't clip in tightly, and if the dogs barely touch it trying to get a drink, it flips out and water gets everywhere. I bought the small 10oz size. We have a larger one, and the shape of the bowl works better for the bracket, but it's too big for our dogs. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality... A little tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *So easy to attach to the crate and to remove when needed. *Once attached, to the crate it's not going anywhere, very sturdy and secure. *The bowl is also really secure in the bracket, even when full. *Holds a lot of water Cons: *The bowl is too secure in the bracket to easily remove. It took a lot to get the thing out so if there's any water left in the bowl you have to scoop it out first or else it will go everywhere. *Difficult to out the bowl back in the bracket. You should remove the bowl, clean it, put it back in the bracket and THEN fill the bowl. Overall I'd recommend this though.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had a 3 story farret cage with vertical bars that are really close together. The farrets were constantly tipping over food dish making a mess & the bottle type waterers all suck. We bought tons they all leak & are not easy to hang on this type of cage. I bought 2 of these bowels & they work perfect! No more dripping water or tipped over food. Would absolutely recommend! Very good quality, good strength & was perfect for what we needed. Thank you so much for making a good bowel to help our solve our cage feeding issues. I could not be more happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Macaw cage and playstands
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of these bowls. Bought them for my macaw's play stand and it was so worth the money. He hated getting to the bottom of the cage for his treats, and I was able to put these at the top of the stand quite easily. He can stand on them, and they are very sturdy. Easy to remove and put back. But please watch your bird's foot. If they are quick, when you snap the bowl back you could easily pinch their little toes. I am always cautious to put them on when he is not around. They are a dream to clean. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water bowls, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a way to give our dogs a little extra water at night and during the day when we aren’t home. The 4 cup bowls give them enough water between meals and their time outside without creating extra bathroom trips. These are easy to install, the dogs haven’t spilled or pulled them off and we have large dogs. The bowl are fitted so it’s a bit of work to take them off and get them back on but not too different and I would rather have the bowls fit tightly. I would recommend these bowls to friends and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherRB

customer_reviews.title: stable and easy
customer_reviews.text: this is my second bowl. the first one we purchased as a water dish. when we put our akita samoyed mix in her "den" she doesn't seem to want to eat or drink too much. but, it gives me peace of mind knowing that there is food available for her. and, that she won't knock it all over her bedding. we leave the door to the kennel open during the day and she will frequently drink water out of that and sometimes i'll put extra kibble in the bowl and she loves getting that little "treat." i find the bowls easy to remove and put back in. just need to be gentle and caring with it.
customer_reviews.author: onelove butterfly

customer_reviews.title: No more messes!
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten this earlier! My girl is crated at night and she was ALWAYS knocking her water over. This thing has been amazing. It is a huge pain to get out, but that's good because it means it wont get knocked over by the dog. I just fill it half way (I got the 2 quart for this reason after reading reviews) and that's the perfect amount for her, and it wont slosh out whenever I go to change the water. Also since it is clipped to the side of the kennel, my girl has room to stretch her legs under it. More space and less mess!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: You couldn't find another way to smother this product in your name like the bowl isn't the most generic steel dog bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how obnoxious it was to get the stickers off the INSIDE AND OUTSIDE of these bowls....why..WHY? You couldn't find another way to smother this product in your name like the bowl isn't the most generic steel dog bowl ever?? Also the holders are great until you need to change the water, then good luck getting it unattached without sloshing it all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Holds water
customer_reviews.text: I have a new rescue dog and got this for his temporary crate while out of the house. He flipped the one I had over everyday. This is he is not able to flip out at all & you are going to have a very difficult time sliding it out to clean it. it fits VERY tight so don't have any liquid in it while trying to get it out. We did give it time to see if it would loosen up with putting in/out however it didn't. Also the holder already started to turn the rust color so not sure how much longer the black would have been gone.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa A Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our bowl from 14 years and 3 dogs ago finally had enough. We decided to go metal instead of plastic this time and I'm so glad we did. Wish I had gotten the size larger but this will do for now. The only problem I had was the actual metal plate for the holder portion of the bowl set. Looks great, no sharp edges, is snug in the holder and hasn't been tipped by the puppy yet! Had the holes lined up and I didn't have to fight with it while a toddler and puppy "helped" set it up, it is a 5 star product. Fix that issue and it'll be golden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult & could be dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Dish is nearly impossible to remove from frame and if dish is not properly inserted into frame, dish falls out leaving two very sturdy pieces that could puncture an eye. Dish is too small for a medium sized dog to last a work day. The only way I could put water in was via a cup and if there was residual water at the end of the day, I had to remove the entire unit, unable to get dish out of frame.
customer_reviews.author: BAILEIGH

customer_reviews.title: Can confirm the attachments are now curved
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these to test out for my larger dog that gets overheated easily. It works great and so far he hasn’t tried to destroy it lol. I liked it so much we bought a second for my smaller dog who is usually more picky about drinking from water bowls but he even likes it. The edges are curved so no danger of sharp edges. Yes, it is hard to push in/remove but that’s the point, my dogs can’t remove the bowls. Just use a small plate or something that covers the top of the bowl as you pull it out and voila no spillage. Bonus, we got both as add on items so really a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Loose fitting
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could love this, but unfortunately, the bowl does not fit snugly in the bracket and my puppy is quite annoying at pulling it out. I have a larger one that I bought in the feed store that works wonderful. Same brand, same design and like I said; that one is great. That is why I bought another one and thought that this time I would just buy it on Amazon. I guess some things are better bought in person so you can actually see and test it. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Loves good books

customer_reviews.title: Durable and excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Likes: The bowl is sturdy, perfect quality, easy to clean and is a great shape. The frame is fantastic quality and secures on a grate easily keeping the bowl steady. Replaces a crock or bowl that would sit on the floor and easily get knocked over. Dislikes: The bowl snaps onto the frame so it must be empty to attach. The snap-on can be difficult at first. My rabbits have no problem yanking it off the frame when they get bored, spilling water everywhere, then bang it around to get my attention and then they fill it with hay. It serves its purpose as long as they don’t look at it too long.
customer_reviews.author: Angelfishu

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl for Ferret Nation!
customer_reviews.text: Small pets are such fun! My chinchillas destroy all plastics and redecorate as they see fit. Sometimes they even decided to redecorate their food bowl. Unfortunately, that put the food on the cage bottom. So far their attempts to redecorate the bowl have yielded unsuccessful, hooray! The locking mechanism seems sturdy and it grips the cage (which has narrow vertical bars and very wide horizontal ones) quite well. The way the bowl comes in and out seems sturdy as well. This is for the 10oz version.
customer_reviews.author: Mini Meep

customer_reviews.title: Bowls are smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: These are great bowls. They attach to the inside of a dog crate easily and don't tip over. But don't be fooled by the product descriptions. The 4-cup bowl holds 3.5 cups to the brim and I would consider it more like a 2-cup bowl. The 8-cup bowl will only hold 7 cups if you fill it to the brim. I would consider this a 4-cup bowl when you allow for space at the top so the water doesn't slosh all over. Fortunately, the company allowed me to return the 4 cup and sent me the 8 cup right away.
customer_reviews.author: Cath

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to Snap
customer_reviews.text: Like some others have noted, these are nearly impossible to snap in and out of the holders. On one hand, it's great that my puppies can't get these bowls dislodged from the crates. However, when I need to take them out to clean them, they are so ridiculously impossible to unsnap that I'm forced to take off the wingnuts and just completely remove the bowl with the mounting fixture. I'm just going to deal, because I really need something secure in our puppies' crates, but what an awful design! The only reasons I didn't give it one star is the price and how secure they are once in place.
customer_reviews.author: Chickie

customer_reviews.title: Pops out easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on the side of the crate for my blind old pup who always steps on and spills her water dish. This was super easy to get on exactly where I wanted it, it’s the perfect size, but it doesn’t fit the holder well. It pops out very easily so my dog bumps into it and it spills anyway. So we ended up just using it like a regular dish because it’s at least smaller than her regular one and fits in the corner of her crate. Kind of defeated the purpose of why we bought it though. Maybe it would work for a dog who can actually see and doesn’t run into it though!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: An excellent way to ensure my dog has water when i need to leave him home alone w/o worrying about him making a mess all over my hardwood floors. Easy to get on & off & my dog's kennel is very old. My dog (75lb pitbull) did not knock it down or destroy it. That's pretty much the highest praise i can give it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: tricky to get bowl out of holder
customer_reviews.text: perfect solution for my kitten's kennel (he goes in it at night time because he's a cord chewer) very sturdy nothing spills, these would also be great for a dog, they really don't budge. The bowls are kind of a pain to get out of the holder, but if you give it a smooth twist while you pull at a slight raised angle, they come right out. I always put them back empty, then fill them though because I'm certain they would spill while snapping back in place. I recommend, unless you have arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Explains

customer_reviews.title: Two Ways to Hold Bowl
customer_reviews.text: I really like this crate bowl. I have several in various sizes. They are well made and fit securely. Some reviewers complain that it is difficult to slide the bowl in and out of the bracket. I agree that you have to be very careful inserting or removing the bowl in this way, especially if there’s water in the bowl that could slosh out. I have found it easier to just set the bowl on top of the bracket arms and push it straight down firmly. The bowl is still held very securely and it’s a lot easier to lift it out vertically rather than sliding it out horizontally from the tight arms.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 10 oz Bowl
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10oz bowl and did manage to get the bowl out of the holder (with a lot of effort). The design of this is great; however, I haven't been able to get the bowl back into the holder the right way. It is very hard to push into the holder and food goes everywhere (although, I should have used common sense to wait and put the food in afterwards). If I can get the bowl in the holder, it will be great. My Westie has managed to go through two other kinds of bowls and broke the holders. Let me try again...
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jean

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit but nice bowl
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers I found that the bowl is a very tight fit and it is difficult to remove. I like the bowl and my rabbit does too. I tried to stretch the metal band that holds the bowl in place but 10 minutes later my bunny yanked it out and water spilled everywhere! I bought the small bowl for a good price. Be warned though it is a very tight fit and removing it with water in it is tough. Water does spill. Nice bowl though and doesn't tip. Pet rabbit can't yank it out.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Swiontek

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - Sturdy for Puppy
customer_reviews.text: We keep our puppy crated while we not at home. She's not quite ready to rule the roost when we're not home just yet. She also sleeps in her crate at night, which I think she honestly prefers. This bowl is really easy to mount to the cage and mounts very tightly to the cage. There's no chance she'll knock the bowl over and make a big mess. The grips that do hold the bowl also have smooth edges so there is no worry of her getting hurt if the bowl isn't there. This dog also moves a lot when she sleeps (much like myself) and despite kicking and flopping about hasn't spilled any water!! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: BluePandaTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: Stickers on stainless is not a great plan
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe in this day and age that we cannot figure out a better way to put product tags on stainless steel other than using stickers. I have literally been working on removing the glue from the stickers since I received this item two weeks ago. The entire bottom and one entire side still has glue remnants even after DOZENS of washings. I’ll now have to buy some goo gone and go from there - awesome product but extremely disappointed in the packaging. I also can’t wait to use it once I finally get the glue off of it. It’s become somewhat of a quest at this point.
customer_reviews.author: robynv

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: While it is easy to clean, And easy to pull the bowl off which is a plus for me. But also a minus as my dog pulls it right off the cage while it’s full of dog food How it fits. It doesn’t fit right. All my cages are standard 42inch cages. The plastic pieces that are in between the meta parts holding it on the cage are quite spaced out enough. And it would be way better to have a 4 way hold so that my dogs can not push it up and down. So water in the cages aren’t even an option with me
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Raines

customer_reviews.title: Best crate bowls out there
customer_reviews.text: I have tried others and sent them back. The Midwest bowls are made well and easy to clean. These easily attach to the crate wherever you like and do not move. The bowls actually stay in place and do not move. I have a very large clumsy cane corso puppy that has yet to knock them out of the holders. I highly recommend these. I have two sets now for both my dogs. Bowls are nice and thick stainless steel with all metal brackets. I will only ever use these going forward.
customer_reviews.author: JaxFL

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product is as described, works as intended. I was tired of my 5 months old puppy playing with water bowl and spilling water all over her crate. Now since I have this water bowl attached to the crate itself, she no longer does that. It’s very sturdy and serves the purpose. I realized I should have bought a bigger size but works well for now as she is still a puppy. She tends to drink a lot of water through out the night so I might get bigger size when she grows.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyDaisy

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl. Big design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, well shaped bowl, with a secure and easy to install bracket. But I'm sorry I bought it. Because you snap the bowl in and out of a "C" clamp from the side, rather than slide it in and out of a ring from the top, water will slosh out if the bowl isn't empty. This, annoyingly, means that you have to put the bowl in empty and then fill it with a bottle. Worse,it makes it hard to change the water! I typically charge the water every day but now I have to wait for the water to be empty. Bottom Line: design flaw. Sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Junkin-Mills

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Remove
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the bowl for a year and as many (most?) of the reviewers have stated, it is difficult to remove/insert the bowl into the holder. You must do this with it empty or water will spill everywhere. I've found it a little easier to remove/insert it using two hands (to get a sturdier/even grip on it). I've also this week noticed a small dot of rust in the bottom of the bowl which I will have to observe to see if it grows and causes me to have to replace it (which I will do with a different product). Edit July 2020: The bowl didn't rust further but the holder did. It's gone in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: All metal and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third product I've purchased for preventing water and food bowl spills in my dog's kennel and it is the first that actually works. I had a similar product that connected to the cage with plastic parts and the dog would just bump into it and it would turn the bowl which would dump out half of its contents. I also tried one of those raised bowl units but it took up too much space and she still managed to knock it over. These Snapy fit bowls are the solution. It is all metal so you can tighten the heck out of the nuts and it the bowl won't tip, budge, or move at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ralk

customer_reviews.title: Generally annoying...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I love these once they are attached and filled. My dog can’t knock them over and they stay in place. BUT, they are such a pain to remove - ESPECIALLY when filled with water. It is impossible to remove the bowl to clean if water is in it and not spill it. It’s really annoying. When installing it, I just slip the bowl in and then fill with water. I will still continue to use these since it is very rare that I leave my dog for more than an hour or so. If I had to use these more often - it would be a no from me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good bowl
customer_reviews.text: I love snappy fit bowls. I have a bunch of them. They aren’t the easiest to take off the base for cleaning but they are really resistant to hard water staining and they are great because the animals can’t tip them over. Also for the Guinea pig it keeps the bowl off the ground so she can’t use it as a litter box. Snappy fit has a lot of sizes to choose from and the quality is outstanding. Couldn’t be happier and I recommend these to everyone with pets.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Frees up real estate inside the kennel
customer_reviews.text: We put the bowl attachment on the kennel door. Prior to this, the bowl would be in Maggie's dog bed and would usually get dumped out during the day. Now, she has full access to her bed and the food is out of the way. The bowl is held VERY securely to the bracket, we only seldom remove the bowl to clean it... otherwise, we just pour the food right into it. With it being on the door, it is way more accessible than reaching into the kennel for the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peters

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to write this one to warn other pet owners to steer clear. I bought these for our puppy’s crate. Great concept, but when put into use, absolutely terrible. Good luck getting the bowl you have water in on and off without water going everywhere because it’s so difficult to get it to secure straight and fully into the clamp. Couldn’t return them because I’d already thrown away the packaging. Within one day I had to trash them...they were useless and frustrating. I ended up getting the type that screw into the stationary base that attaches to the crate. What a horrible waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bagozzi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and mess free bowl
customer_reviews.text: I have had this MidWest water bowl for less than 24 hours and love it (my puppy does too). I was afraid it would be in the way and, or splash all over crate. There have been none of those problems. I found a convenient spot in between the two door openings to place the bowl, so it is out of the way. Additionally, I am able to remove and place the bowl, with water, without it sloshing all over. I shimmy the bowl out or replace and no messes are made. You just have to patiently angle the bowl into place. Also, a previous reviewer mentioned sharp edges on the holder. The edges are all safe and rounded.
customer_reviews.author: jchussey

customer_reviews.title: Minor learning curve, derp!
customer_reviews.text: Learning curve: don't try to remove/replace bowl while it has water in it. Wait until it's empty to remove, or stick a couple paper towels in there to sop it up before 'unsnapping'. Otherwise, it works great so far. Needed to provide just water for a dog under activity restriction after ACL surgery. Particularly like that I can put it anywhere in the cage and adjust it up/down as needed. Protip - put it on the HINGE side, on the wall adjacent to the door. ON the door, it sloshed. On the latch side of the door, the dog smashed into it a lot. On that hinge side, it stays put.
customer_reviews.author: A. SpenglerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: loved this
customer_reviews.text: great product, super sturdy. I've read complaints about splashing when putting the water dish in the holder. It clips in and is super sturdy, so the water bowl will need to be filled when the dish is clipped in place to avoid spills. great product for the price. Works well for small and medium size dogs. Would be great for small animals and cats as well. My dog is 60 lbs and it they worked great for her when she was crated during recovery from surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 10 oz is super small, recommend the 20 oz
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 lbs Labrador Retriever and I bought the 10 oz bowl just to give him access to water when I have to leave him in his kennel. The 10 oz is SUPER small (as you can see from the picture, my kennel is a massive 36”). I probably should have gotten the 20 oz, since I’m probably going to have to refill it every time I leave him in his kennel. Super easy to remove, however since it is such a small bowl it’s going to be a hassle to keep removing it and having to refill it. Highly recommend the BIGGER bowl because the small seems really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good with one major drawback
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10 oz bowl which is very small and really does not hold that much water (I should have paid attention when ordering, my bad). The bowl is very easy to attach to the crate and the whole set is high quality. My only complaint about this bowl is that removing it from the brace once attached is very difficult and you will almost certainly spill any water that is still left in the bowl. I have been unscrewing the whole thing instead of trying to jerk the bowl out of the brace. I would recommend this product overall but for me this is one major drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Cat I am

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kittens or small dogs
customer_reviews.text: If you have any cats/ kittens (or animals in general) that require being in a wire pen, these bowls are great! I ordered two back in April whenwe first rounded up A stray cat and her babies, and I just ordered two more for their new enclosure. The bowls do take some force to remove from the holder, however we have discovered KFC To- Go bowls (like the ones they serve coleslaw, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes in) are PERFECT size to sit in the metal bowl, and are easy to remove. I highly recommend them! I even shared a link with my local cat rescue. They even hold up to 3lb kittens who like to sleep in them.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Dishes
customer_reviews.text: After reading MANY reviews I was hesitant to purchase these bowls. I am so glad that I did! They were stiff to get in and out to start, but after using them a bit, they are super easy. I use these for food, not water. I could see if using for water, that as they click in, it may make a mess. Workaround...click it in, then fill it up. Ta-da! I have purchased these for all my dogs, and recommend them to my training clients too. They work like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: PawsDog

customer_reviews.title: After much research I bought these for my wire dog crate.
customer_reviews.text: After much research I bought these for my wire dog crate. A little tight to snap in but that’s needed to support them securely to the side. I would recommend that you snap the bowls in place first, then fill with food and water, because they snap quick and secure very snug. If full of water or food it will spill as it locks into place. No big deal to do in this order considering they fit tight and very secure by design. I have used for several months and the stainless steel is holding up and I have had no rust yet. Happy with savings buying on Amazon vs retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: SMACKDOWN

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, But The Fit Is Too Tight To Use!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews from other purchasers warned me, but since I needed a water bowl for my Midwest Crate, I thought that a bowl specifically made by Midwest for their own crates couldn't possibly be as difficult to use as some people were saying. Boy, was I wrong! These "Snappy Fit" Bowls are next to impossible to remove from their holders even without anything in them. Filled with water or even just food...FORGET it! The bowls look great and seem quite sturdy, but the fit is just too tight to remove. Even my strong son-in-law, couldn't pry the bowl out of its holder while it was attached to the crate! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: miznonny

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to pull out of the brackets, sends food and water flying everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these, but i initially bought them because of the great reviews, so I felt it was only right for me to leave one. I bought these so that I could have something sturdy to attach to my fosters kitten cage to avoid them spilling the bowls and making a huge mess. However, when you need to remove these bowls from the brackets to clean them (especially changing the water) they are so incredibly hard to remove that any remaining contents FLIES EVERYWHERE. creating a huge mess, and completely defeating the purpose of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Steel City Adventure Cats

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, useful, difficult to remove
customer_reviews.text: This bowl works very well for an in crate water bowl. It was super easy to install and stays in place well but it is not easy to take in and out of the brace which I guess works to steady the bowl in the crate but has lead us to use a bottle to refill it instead of taking it out of the crate to refill cause its just too much of a hassle...and forget trying to snap it in place when it is full cause the water will splash everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Eisen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for their crates and the pups prefer them to their other floor bowls maybe it's easier for them as it's at a good level. I have water bowls outside and in the kitchen and they usually pass them both to come in to drink from these. very sturdy. Doesn't tip or spill. A little hard to get the bowl on and off so I never fill the bowl more than half as you tend to spill it trying to get it on/off. And I did have them further in the crates but have since moved them and attached to bowls to the crate doors and it's easier to get bowls on/off
customer_reviews.author: danielle p.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These are working out really well for me. I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are working out really well for me. I have large, active dogs and they do not knock the bowls out. I thought about getting the larger size, but decided since my dogs eat several small meals, these would work. However, even when I increase the feed for a pregnant female, there is plenty of room in these bowls (I just fill them to the top). These bowls have solved several problems for me. I am thankful that they exist.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works but could be a notch better
customer_reviews.text: I'm not overly impressed with this. It's impossible to remove the bowl from the holder without sloshing out remaining water. It is easy to clean...it's a bowl! Installation of the unit is simple. I reinsert the bowl empty and then fill it. I've started putting just a little bit of water in it...enough for a few sips for the little time I put the puppy inside. If I put too much, I have a puddle to clean up and a mat to dry.
customer_reviews.author: goldngemgirl

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WIRED KENNEL
customer_reviews.text: These WILL NOT work on the plastic paneled puppy/dog pen. These will ONY work on wired kennels etc. I had bought 2 of these for my daughters new puppy. And I had also bought the IRIS puppy 4 panel pen. These DO NOT work for that pen. I was disappointed because some reviews said that they would work...I had waited too long to find that out so I got stuck with them and couldn’t return. Maybe this review will help someone know that they won’t and won’t make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Small and starting to rust
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for less than a week and it is already starting to rust around the rims. I don't want to have to buy another, but stainless steel should be sturdier than what it is. This is much smaller (4 cups) than I thought it would be. I'll likely need to resale, re-purpose and get the 8 cups because I have a large breed dog (malamute) and they need more than 4 cups, which he can drink in probably 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: L.Layale

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: So, while these are a perfect solution to a birds dish throwing habit they are very hard to remove and replace.. They didnt really serve my purposes but I do fault the product itself.. The snap lock is VERY strong and holds tight.. Unfortunately for me i have a very unsocialized bird with a temper and who will not allow anyone in his cage to change his eater/food... Overall the product is amazing and I do recommend, just be warned they are a tight tight snap.. Also keep hands and fingers clear qhen snapping in..
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: For me it's easier to remove the bowl by unscrewing everything. I should be able to tug at the Snapy Fit from the inside to get the bowl instead of having to remove the entire system. Unfortunately the Snappy Fit is soooooo tight I cannot get the bowl out.
customer_reviews.author: clickclack

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This 20 ounce bowl works great with our 30" dog kennel while our dachshund's on crate rest for IVDD. As other reviews note, it's really difficult to remove the bowl from the clasp when it's full of water, so we're actually using a porcelain water bowl as an insert inside it instead. The arm, fastener, and bowl are good, sturdy, heavy duty quality. So all in all it works great, and is not easy for our boy to knock or spill unlike some of the other products out there.
customer_reviews.author: miriam r

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, almost too sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. The product is nice and very sturdy, but almost too sturdy. It's SO hard to get the bowls in and out that whatever is in them invariably sloshes or flies out. The clamps that hold the bowls are so tight. I even tried prying them wider but they're so thick/strong. I gave up and just started putting the bowls on top of the clamps rather than sliding them into the clamps. Another solution would be to bring whatever you're putting in them to the bowl rather than taking them out each time.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Great and priced right
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these now. I had to weld one after an accident with a dog. Not a huge problem because the metal was heavy enough to work with. I put mine a little higher up because my dogs will try to bury food if they don't eat it all, the original reason I bought these. Then having mostly male dogs I always end up with someone peeing in their bowl, a quick snap and a rinse and back up it goes. I love these, they're not for food bowl packers. They can be removed by those kinds of dogs. But for a kennel situation or a crate situation I've been very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and works well
customer_reviews.text: This bowl works well in our dog's crate. She loves it - it's her preferred drinking bowl, even though she has bigger bowls around the house. It's sturdy and works well. (We usually keep her crate door closed during the day because she drags the bedding out. She started drinking water out of her crate bowl from "outside" her crate, which made a mess. We had to fashion a shield so that she couldn't get her tongue through the crate bars to drink the water. That's how much she likes drinking from her stainless crate bowl.)
customer_reviews.author: ALKinPHX

customer_reviews.title: MISSING VITAL PARTS
customer_reviews.text: Not too happy right now. I ordered 2 -- one for water, one for food -- and only one of the bowls came with the mounting bracket. If I just wanted a bowl I would keep the ones we already have. Ridiculous. Also, the bowls are deep but not very wide. I have a 50lb border collie and the 1qt bowls should be enough capacity but unfortunately, due to the short diameter, she will need the twice as expensive, twice as large, 2qt bowls. Outrageous. Quality of material seems great so they get 2 stars instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M

customer_reviews.title: Great for a messy dog - wish I had bought the bigger size
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a water bowl in my dogs crate. She kept knocking the old one over. This is a brilliant solution to that. It's super study; she even sleeps with her head on it sometimes (while it's filled with water - my dog is weird like that). I sort of wish I had bought 1 size up (4 cups instead of 2.5 cups). I hadn't realized how much my shepherd mix drinks. I find myself topping it off twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased 2 of these bowls, and then purchased 6 more to hold food and water in wire dog kennels. Easy to install, nice size, sturdy, stainless bowls are perfect for the intended use. A wing on one of the wingnuts in the second order was broken upon arrival, though, so I'll contact seller for a replacement. Snap in/out is convenient, but I don't use that feature, since these are mounted on 1 of the double doors.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The bowl rusts
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first couple of months but then the bowl started to RUST on the inside. The bowl is supposed to be stainless steel which does not rust, so I am assuming that this is a counterfeit product being sold on Amazon with a coating and not actual stainless steel. It's too late to return it, but very disappointed since this bracket is only compatible with their specific bowl...
customer_reviews.author: Francis Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great for sugar gliders!
customer_reviews.text: These are PERFECT for my sugar gliders! I have four colonies and use these bowls for all of them. I was afraid they would be too deep, but my babies have no issues getting their food out of the bowls. Cleaning is so easy (which is no easy feat with their messy food and eating habits). They clip in right, so I don't worry about one falling and hurting/killing one of my gliders. I got a total of eight... I only put four of the holders in, and then rotate their daytime snack and nighttime meal.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Cass

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: We've went through a few water bowls due to the new collie puppy chewing anything plastic. One set was a metal bowl with plastic holder and that didn't fair well either. Purchased the 20 ounce and the smaller one for one large and one miniature dogs. Solid metal and good sized. Most impressed with the sturdy hold as it has an extra piece that keeps it tight between the inside/outside pieces when tightened. Bowl is tough to get into holder, but doable which is great so the dog doesn't pull it out.
customer_reviews.author: JBP

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, but difficult to pull bowl apart from frame for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The metal brace is very sturdy, & your down will not be able to tip the bowl over in the crate. Cons: Very difficult to pull apart the bowl & the frame.bracket.. If there is any food/water in the bowl when you try to pull it apart from the frame it will spill all over the place (i.e. if you go to water in the ball gets dirty and you want to dump it/ clean the bowl). This design would have worked better if the frame was circular and the bowl set on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Bowl I Use For Rabbits' Water
customer_reviews.text: I received the rounded end clamp version. Well built clamp system that holds the bowl securely in place. I use this 20oz size for water as I find it too shallow for food use with rabbits. They easily push the food out. The larger 4 cup size works better for rabbit food. Being able to mount the bowl high on the cage side helps keep the rabbits fron sitting in the water. Well worth the $6.35 I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Danny BoydTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to attach to the crate and easily detatches so ...
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to attach to the crate and easily detatches so the crate can be folded and moved. The only problem is that getting the bowls into/out of the holders requires a bit of force, so you can't take them out/put them in when you have food/water in the bowl without some of it getting on the crate floor. That being said, that also means the dog isn't going to accidentally knock the bowl out, so we'll take it.
customer_reviews.author: Rorian13

customer_reviews.title: Strong, durable, stays in place, survives strong puppy chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bowl for my puppy's kennel. He is a 3 month old large breed dog and chews on everything! This bowl attaches to his kennel and does not move. Because it is metal he doesn't chew on it very often, but the few times he does, you can't tell! He can't reach the back of the mounting gear so he can't detsroy it. The rails that hold the bowl are also metal and don't flex. I am so happy to have found a bowl that was designed with strong chewers and puppies in mind. I will definitely be buying more over time as our family changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems small for four cups
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the clamp portion (that goes around the bowl) is a little tight and I spilled a lot of water every time I would push the bowl in, or pull the bowl out, of the clamps. Once I loosened them up a little bit, it was much better. My dog really enjoys having a small water bowl in his crate. I would say that if you are getting this for food, size up, I am skeptical that this really fits four cups.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Attaches FIRMLY to crate
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much for the price, but this is great! My dog loves to play with and tip over her water bowls, but this is firmly attached to the crate. It's a little difficult to get the bowl part out to wash it and then get it back in because its such a snug fit, but after a few weeks, my dog has only been able to remove it once and that's because I didn't reattach it correctly. Best crate bowl for the price for sure! My dog loves that it is raised up to her height, so she has stopped drinking out of her regular bowl completely and always goes into her crate for a drink now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Food Bowl
customer_reviews.text: The food bowls are well made out of heavier stainless steel than many dog dishes. The attachment works well but requires a good bit of pressure to get the pet bowl in or out. It is held firmly once in place and the holder can be adjusted for the proper height for your pet. I believe that they are well made and should hold up to normal usage for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: rshirley10

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Bowls
customer_reviews.text: We love these bowls. We have purchased 4 of them; 2 for our border collie's crate and 2 for our english bulldog's crate. They hold up well, are very sturdy, easy to clean, and fairly easy to slide out. Attaching them to the cage took no time at all. They can't be chewed on or destroyed either, which is a big plus as my dogs are chewers! I highly recommend these bowls!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Strong
customer_reviews.text: I ordered twice. I thought it would be bigger for my 80lb dog but it works better for my 18 lbs dog (my fault, need to read the dimensions a little better). I like that my pups are not eating off the floor. Also my little fluff ball likes to redecorate his kennel and his space multiple times a week so I got tired of him being strong enough to do this. This fixes his problem and I think he likes not having his bowls in his stretching/relax space. Easy to install. my 8 year old helped me put it on the kennel to just to see if she could do it.
customer_reviews.author: Shamara Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best crate bowl I've found. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: When bowls are just set in a crate cats and dogs will knock them over without fail. I've tried other bowls that attach to crates and they were awkward and difficult to take in and out to refill. These bowls are very easy to put in and remove without spilling once I spread the arms that hold the bowl apart a little. It doesn't take a lot of hand strength to spread the arms out. I spread them once and tried them for fit and then spread them again and they are perfect. Still tight enough to hold bowl and easy remove and replace.
customer_reviews.author: jfarm

customer_reviews.title: Well made, excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. The bowl fits snugly enough in its frame that my over enthusiastic 8 month old lab can’t pull it out but not so tough I can’t use my primate abilities to remove it. Our kids can’t seem to manage it (shocking) but at least they won’t take the bowl and lose it. The frame is sturdy, and the portion that holds the bowl has nicely rounded edges, so there won’t be any impalement while the bowl is being washed. When the package arrived, it contained only the bowl, but the manufacturer was quick to send the clamp/frame when I contacted them. Overall we are very happy with this purchase and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rees

customer_reviews.title: Literal perfection
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give 5 stars because there's always something I wish was improved...but this bowl mount is so well made! I've tried multiple other plastic ones and this is 100% better. Sturdy with rubber grips at varying distances so it'll grip all cage widths. My 35lb puppy likes to use her bowl as a head rest and it doesn't even sag. I can't speak highly enough about this. Save your money and just buy this one to start. IT'S WORTH IT
customer_reviews.author: Ripcord

customer_reviews.title: I love these bowls! Perfect for my rabbit needs!
customer_reviews.text: I love these bowls! I bought 2 of the 20oz to be my rabbits food bowls and just bought 2 more of the 4 cup bowls to be their water bowls. They hook easily onto their pens, are easy to remove and put back into place. I agree with other reviews that say you need to pull the black metal bowl holder to loosen it a little as it is stiff when you first get the bowls. After pulling on the metal just a little to stretch, they work like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: ivy

customer_reviews.title: Quality bowl, hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: I use this bowl for water in my dog's crate. Pros: solid construction, easy to install, easy to clean, good size for water. Cons: the bowl snaps into the spring tightly, so if you need to remove it when there is water in it, it is difficult to do without it spilling. This would work well for food or if you only clean it when it's empty. Perhaps I could try to bend the tangs open a little to loosen it but it's pretty tough metal.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you think it is. Holder clamps to ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you think it is. Holder clamps to the dog cage and it holds the bowl - quite snuggly might I add. I would NOT suggest water unless you plan to pour the water in. The clamp holds the bowl tight enough that if you filled it with water and then tried to push it into the clamp, you would spill everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: David Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: My pit has separation anxiety issues and is destructive so he has to stay in his crate whenever we leave. Sometimes he immediately goes to his water bowl to drink when we get home. He will spill a bowl left in the bottom so I thought I would try this. Left him for about 6 hours yesterday and the bowl was empty when I got home. Very very happy with this purchase. It was easy to install and now he will be even more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: tellkyler

customer_reviews.title: Very practical and exactly as expected. Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Got the small (20 oz), and it was the perfect size bowl or a small - med size dog. The only complaint I have is that it is very hard to put back. It is easy to remove and fill up. But then putting it back (especially after it is filled with word) is difficult to put back in It is just tight and hard to maneuver because it is inside the cage. But I guess that is what is needed to keep it sturdy, so it doesn't fall out. And the price was great. I still would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not a FIRM hold with the 20 ounce, 10 oz is great!
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that this larger bowl didn't work as great as the smaller size. I have a 10 week Australian shepherd mix and he uses the smaller bowl for water, which is a great product. The stability of the larger bowl is weak, bowl easily slides off, and the "arms" just don't hold!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and solid.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Put it up in my kennel so they can't dislodge it or dump the water. Only thing is that the stickers are very hard to get off, which is frustrating. Both are high enough to allow my dog to stretch under them but low enough to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a small bowl for water while my dog is crated. Good design and easy to install, but I just can't figure out how to remove the bowl for cleaning... I had to pull it, but it wasn't easy. It may be supposed to be this way, but I need to make sure the bowl is empty so I won't make a mess in the room... I plan to get a second one for food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: They are a little hard to take it and out BUT that's what I like about them since I have two huskies who like to push things with their noses. We just leave them and refill them which it's in the holder. When empty then we take them out to clean. Our two are on different foods so they have to eat separate in their crates. This product has made our lives so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Love these bowls
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bowls for our messy ferret. He is in a ferret nation cage so these bowls lock right into the bars perfectly. They are easy to install onto the cage and can be a little hard to take off to clean or refill but that ends up being a good thing. I highly recommend these if you have a messy ferret or something similar that likes to sling their food everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: RDS

customer_reviews.title: Get Something Better
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to manipulate to get the bowl in-between the holder with food in it. It doesn't just slide in, you have to almost "snap" the bowl in place. By that time, I've spilled all my pet food!
customer_reviews.author: kaykath

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my lab mix and my boxer rottie mix ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my lab mix and my boxer rottie mix. The bowl itself is a little shallow so opening and closing the door is a little more difficult to do without spilling the water. I would assume the larger sizes would be deeper, not wide and shallow. It takes up a lot of space. Putting in and removing the bowl if used for water almost requires the bowl to be empty or water WILL spill out. They seem secure and well made/easy to install, however they are not very convenient for every day filling and emptying.
customer_reviews.author: Kalyn

product_meta.title: MidWest Homes for Pets Snap'y Fit Stainless Steel Food Bowl/Pet Bowl
product_meta.description: Size:20 Ounces (2.5 cups)The Snap’y Fit stainless steel pet bowl by MidWest Homes for Pets features a patented design that holds the dog bowl firmly in place but still allows the pet bowl to easily be removed for cleaning. The pet bowl comes with a rust resistant e-coated bracket that attaches to the dog crate / cat cage / bird cage or small animal cage with two wing nuts. Since the food bowl / water bowl attaches to the dog crate wire mesh it promotes healthy elevated eating and conveniently keeps the pet bowl from being knocked over (no-tip design) by pets and pet parents alike eliminating potential mealtime messes. The Snap’y Fit pet bowl comes in 4 different sizes; 10 oz. (1.25 cups), 20 oz. (2.5 cups), 1 qt. (4 cups), 2 qt. (8 cups) making this a great food bowl or water bowl for a variety of pets including dogs, cats, birds and many other small animals. The stainless-steel pet bowl is dishwasher safe for easy cleaning and does not hold bad odors or germs like plastic food bowl does. We at MidWest Homes for Pets understand that your pet is a part of your family and that’s why we ensure our products are manufactured with the highest quality control standards creating a safe home for your pet that you can feel confident with. MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with a 1-year Manufacturer’s Warranty. If you have any questions about our Snap’y Fit food bowls / water bowls our customer service department would be glad to help you. MidWest customer service can be contacted, available 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Monday – Friday.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel 20 ounce (2.5 cups) dog food / water bowl for puppies, dogs, kittens, cats & small animals
Pet bowl locks in place on dog crate / cat cage / bird cage with easy-to-remove bracket which reduces water & food spilling in pets living area
Pet bowl holds up to 20 ounce dog food, cat food or water & minimizes cleaning w/ no-tip bracketed design
Dog bowl / cat bowl is rust resistant & is a healthy alternative to plastic food bowls, pet bowl doesn't hold odors
Dishwasher safe stainless steel dog bowl for easy cleaning, includes a 1-year Manufacturer Warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061.
